trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn"></xref> objects in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control.
You can retrieve an instance of this class through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Columns%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control.
The collection maintains a reference to the control through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnCollection.DataGridView%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnCollection"></xref> class for the given <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> that created this collection.
Adds the given column to the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn"></xref> to add.
The index of the column.
dataGridViewColumn is `null`.
The associated <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control is performing one of the following actions that temporarily prevents new columns from being added:
Selecting all cells in the control.
Clearing the selection.
Updating column <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.DisplayIndex"></xref> property values.
-or-
This method is being called from a handler for one of the following <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> events:
-or-
dataGridViewColumn already belongs to a control.
-or-
The dataGridViewColumn property value is and the property value is or .

Use the control <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.System#ComponentModel#ISupportInitialize#BeginInit"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.System#ComponentModel#ISupportInitialize#EndInit"></xref> methods to temporarily set conflicting property values.
-or-
The dataGridViewColumn property value is and the property value is `false`.
-or-
dataGridViewColumn has an property value of and a property value of `true`.
-or-
dataGridViewColumn has a property value that would cause the combined values of all columns in the control to exceed 65535.
-or-
dataGridViewColumn has and property values that would display it among a set of adjacent columns with the opposite property value.
-or-
The control contains at least one row and dataGridViewColumn has a property value of `null`.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTextBoxColumn"></xref> with the given column name and column header text to the collection.

The `columnName` and `headerText` parameters are related to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.Name%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.HeaderText%2A> properties, respectively.
The name by which the column will be referred.
The text for the column's header.
The index of the column.
The associated <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control is performing one of the following actions that temporarily prevents new columns from being added:
Selecting all cells in the control.
Clearing the selection.
Updating column <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.DisplayIndex"></xref> property values.
-or-
This method is being called from a handler for one of the following <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> events:
-or-

The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SelectionMode"></xref> property value is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectionMode.FullColumnSelect"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectionMode.ColumnHeaderSelect"></xref>, which conflicts with the default column <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.SortMode"></xref> property value of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnSortMode.Automatic"></xref>.
-or-

The default column <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.FillWeight"></xref> property value of 100 would cause the combined <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.FillWeight"></xref> values of all columns in the control to exceed 65535.
Adds a range of columns to the collection.
An array of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn"></xref> objects to add.
dataGridViewColumns is `null`.
The associated <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control is performing one of the following actions that temporarily prevents new columns from being added:
Selecting all cells in the control.
Clearing the selection.
Updating column <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.DisplayIndex"></xref> property values.
-or-
This method is being called from a handler for one of the following <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> events:
-or-
At least one of the values in dataGridViewColumns is `null`.
-or-
At least one of the columns in dataGridViewColumns already belongs to a control.
-or-
At least one of the columns in dataGridViewColumns has a property value of `null` and the control contains at least one row.
-or-
At least one of the columns in dataGridViewColumns has a property value of and the property value is or .

Use the control <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.System#ComponentModel#ISupportInitialize#BeginInit"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.System#ComponentModel#ISupportInitialize#EndInit"></xref> methods to temporarily set conflicting property values.
-or-
At least one of the columns in dataGridViewColumns has an property value of and the property value is `false`.
-or-
At least one of the columns in dataGridViewColumns has an property value of and a property value of `true`.
-or-
The columns in dataGridViewColumns have property values that would cause the combined values of all columns in the control to exceed 65535.
-or-
At least two of the values in dataGridViewColumns are references to the same .
-or-
At least one of the columns in dataGridViewColumns has and property values that would display it among a set of adjacent columns with the opposite property value.
Clears the collection.
The associated <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control is performing one of the following actions that temporarily prevents new columns from being added:
Selecting all cells in the control.
Clearing the selection.
Updating column <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.DisplayIndex"></xref> property values.
-or-
This method is being called from a handler for one of the following <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> events:
Occurs when the collection changes.
Examples of collection changes include additions or removals of columns.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
Determines whether the collection contains the column referred to by the given name.
The name of a column is indicated by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.Name%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The name of the column to look for.
`true` if the column is contained in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
columnName is `null`.
Determines whether the collection contains the given column.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn"></xref> to look for.
`true` if the given column is in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Copies the items from the collection to the given array.
The destination <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn"></xref> array.
The index of the destination array at which to start copying.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> upon which the collection performs column-related operations.
<xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref>.
Returns the number of columns that meet the given filter requirements.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values that represent the filter for inclusion.
The number of columns that meet the filter requirements.
includeFilter is not a valid bitwise combination of values.
Returns the width, in pixels, required to display all of the columns that meet the given filter requirements.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values that represent the filter for inclusion.
The width, in pixels, that is necessary to display all of the columns that meet the filter requirements.
includeFilter is not a valid bitwise combination of values.
Returns the first column in display order that meets the given inclusion-filter requirements.

The first column in display order is the column with the lowest <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.DisplayIndex%2A> value, regardless of whether the column is actually visible on the screen.
This method lets you determine the first column that fits the given criteria without having to compare index values directly.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values that represents the filter for inclusion.
The first column in display order that meets the given filter requirements, or `null` if no column is found.
includeFilter is not a valid bitwise combination of values.
Returns the first column in display order that meets the given inclusion-filter and exclusion-filter requirements.

The first column in display order is the column with the lowest <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.DisplayIndex%2A> value, regardless of whether the column is actually visible on the screen.
This method lets you determine the first column that fits the given criteria without having to compare index values directly.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values that represent the filter to apply for inclusion.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values that represent the filter to apply for exclusion.
The first column in display order that meets the given filter requirements, or `null` if no column is found.
At least one of the filter values is not a valid bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values.
Returns the last column in display order that meets the given filter requirements.

The last column in display order is the column with the highest <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.DisplayIndex%2A> value, regardless of whether the column is actually visible on the screen.
This method lets you determine the last column that fits the given criteria without having to compare index values directly.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values that represent the filter to apply for inclusion.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values that represent the filter to apply for exclusion.
The last displayed column in display order that meets the given filter requirements, or `null` if no column is found.
At least one of the filter values is not a valid bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values.
Gets the first column after the given column in display order that meets the given filter requirements.

The next column in display order is the column with the lowest <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.DisplayIndex%2A> value higher than the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.DisplayIndex%2A> value of the specified column, regardless of whether the column is actually visible on the screen.
This method lets you determine the next column after the current column that fits the given criteria without having to compare index values directly.
The column from which to start searching for the next column.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values that represent the filter to apply for inclusion.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values that represent the filter to apply for exclusion.
The next column that meets the given filter requirements, or `null` if no column is found.
dataGridViewColumnStart is `null`.
At least one of the filter values is not a valid bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values.
Gets the last column prior to the given column in display order that meets the given filter requirements.

The previous column in display order is the column with the highest <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.DisplayIndex%2A> value lower than the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.DisplayIndex%2A> value of the specified column, regardless of whether the column is actually visible on the screen.
This method lets you determine the first column before the current column that fits the given criteria without having to compare index values directly.
The column from which to start searching for the previous column.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values that represent the filter to apply for inclusion.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values that represent the filter to apply for exclusion.
The previous column that meets the given filter requirements, or `null` if no column is found.
dataGridViewColumnStart is `null`.
At least one of the filter values is not a valid bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values.
Gets the index of the given <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn"></xref> in the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn"></xref> to return the index of.
The index of the given <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn"></xref>.
Inserts a column at the given index in the collection.
The zero-based index at which to insert the given column.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn"></xref> to insert.
dataGridViewColumn is `null`.
The associated <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control is performing one of the following actions that temporarily prevents new columns from being added:
Selecting all cells in the control.
Clearing the selection.
Updating column <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.DisplayIndex"></xref> property values.
-or-
This method is being called from a handler for one of the following <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> events:
-or-
dataGridViewColumn already belongs to a control.
-or-
The dataGridViewColumn property value is and the property value is or .

Use the control <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.System#ComponentModel#ISupportInitialize#BeginInit"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.System#ComponentModel#ISupportInitialize#EndInit"></xref> methods to temporarily set conflicting property values.
-or-
The dataGridViewColumn property value is and the property value is `false`.
-or-
dataGridViewColumn has an property value of and a property value of `true`.
-or-
dataGridViewColumn has and property values that would display it among a set of adjacent columns with the opposite property value.
-or-
The control contains at least one row and dataGridViewColumn has a property value of `null`.
Gets or sets the column of the given name in the collection.
The name of the column to get or set.
The identified by the columnName parameter.
columnName is `null`.
Gets or sets the column at the given index in the collection.
The zero-based index of the column to get or set.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn"></xref> at the given index.
index is less than zero or greater than the number of columns in the collection minus one.
Gets the list of elements contained in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.BaseCollection"></xref> instance.
An <xref href="System.Collections.ArrayList"></xref> containing the elements of the collection.
This property returns `null` unless overridden in a derived class.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnCollection.CollectionChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnCollection.OnCollectionChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.CollectionChangeEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Removes the column with the specified name from the collection.
The name of a column is indicated by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.Name%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.

To remove a column that is automatically generated when binding to a data source, call this method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataBindingComplete?displayProperty=fullName> event handler.
The name of the column to delete.
columnName does not match the name of any column in the collection.
columnName is `null`.
The associated <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control is performing one of the following actions that temporarily prevents new columns from being added:
Selecting all cells in the control.
Clearing the selection.
Updating column <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.DisplayIndex"></xref> property values.
-or-
This method is being called from a handler for one of the following <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> events:
Removes the specified column from the collection.

To remove a column that is automatically generated when binding to a data source, call this method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataBindingComplete?displayProperty=fullName> event handler.
The column to delete.
dataGridViewColumn is not in the collection.
dataGridViewColumn is `null`.
The associated <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control is performing one of the following actions that temporarily prevents new columns from being added:
Selecting all cells in the control.
Clearing the selection.
Updating column <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.DisplayIndex"></xref> property values.
-or-
This method is being called from a handler for one of the following <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> events:
Removes the column at the given index in the collection.

To remove a column that is automatically generated when binding to a data source, call this method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataBindingComplete?displayProperty=fullName> event handler.
The index of the column to delete.
index is less than zero or greater than the number of columns in the control minus one.
The associated <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control is performing one of the following actions that temporarily prevents new columns from being added:
Selecting all cells in the control.
Clearing the selection.
Updating column <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.DisplayIndex"></xref> property values.
-or-
This method is being called from a handler for one of the following <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> events:
Copies the entire contents of the collection to a compatible one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref>, starting at the specified index of the target array.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
The one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that is the destination of the elements copied from the current collection.
The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.
array is `null`.
index is less than 0.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of elements in the source collection is greater than the available space from index to the end of array.
The type of the source element cannot be cast automatically to the type of array.
Gets the number of elements in the collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
The number of elements in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnCollection"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether access to the collection is synchronized.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
`false` in all cases.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that can be used to iterate through the collection.
Adds an object to the end of the collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to add to the end of the collection.
The value can be `null`.
The index at which value has been added.
value is not a .
value is `null`.
